Summary: Disruption between Arbroath and Aberdeen expected until 18:00
Description:
A safety inspection of the track between Arbroath and Stonehaven means that all lines are closed.

Trains operating between Arbroath and Aberdeen may be cancelled or revised as a result.

Disruption is expected until 18:00.

LNER customer advice:

Services may terminate at and start back from Edinburgh.

ScotRail customer advice:

Your ticket can be used on alternative ScotRail services via any reasonable route in order to complete your journey, at no additional cost.

Your ticket can also be used at no extra cost on Stagecoach East services between Dundee and Arbroath.

If you have had to drive to another station your ticket will be valid to collect your car on your return journey. Speak to a member of staff to validate your ticket.

You might wish to consider postponing your journey until services return to normal.

Check before you travel:

You can check your journey using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner.

Compensation:

You may be entitled to compensation if you experience a delay in completing your journey today. Please keep your train ticket and make a note of your journey, as both will be required to support any claim.

Affects.RoutesAffected:
LNER between London Kings Cross / York and Aberdeen

ScotRail between Glasgow Queen Street / Edinburgh and Aberdeen, between Glasgow Queen Street and Inverness, and also between Dundee and Arbroath
